$ZIM so now we have the mystery solved of why $ZIM dumped so irrationally in Q3- https://seekingalpha.com/article/4556411-danaos-sold-off-zim-stake-net-debt-focus-buybacks?mailingid=29675515&messageid=must_reads&serial=29675515.136365&utm_campaign=Must%2BReads%2BNovember%2B11%2C%2B2022&utm_content=seeking_alpha&utm_medium=email&utm_source=seeking_alpha&utm_term=must_reads

The decision of $DAC to liquidate their position likely put unique downward pressure on the stock while in a natural downward trend from the ridiculous highs of Q2. This almost certainly means that the push into the 20s has been a huge overshoot in the sell off. Either that or some inside information of a big issue was used to front run Q3. I guess we will know on the 16th but the above certainly explains the huge overselling vs. peers given $DAC ‚Äòs huge previous position
